content.question: The student has no way to directly measure the capacitances but measures the potential difference across each capacitor and finds that they are the same. What can be concluded about the dielectric constants <math alttext="kappa" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>κ</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> of the materials?

choices.label: <math alttext="kappa sub X equals kappa sub Y, which equals kappa sub Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>κ</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>X</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>κ</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>Y</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>κ</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>Z</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></math>

<math alttext="kappa sub X is less than kappa sub Y, which is less than kappa sub Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>κ</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>X</mi></mrow></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mrow><mi>κ</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>Y</mi></mrow></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mrow><mi>κ</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>Z</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></math>

<math alttext="kappa sub X is greater than kappa sub Y, which is greater than kappa sub Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>κ</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>X</mi></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi>κ</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>Y</mi></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi>κ</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>Z</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></math>
Nothing can be concluded about the dielectric constants without knowing the capacitances of the capacitors.

content.answer: <math alttext="kappa sub X is less than kappa sub Y, which is less than kappa sub Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>κ</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>X</mi></mrow></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mrow><mi>κ</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>Y</mi></mrow></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mrow><mi>κ</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>Z</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
